other_tests.findings: Turbid yellow ascitic fluid; lactate dehydrogenase level, 805 U/L; glucose level, 4.6 mmol/L; protein level, 44 g/L.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 4 months of fluconazole therapy, the dosage was reduced to 200 mg daily and continued for another 4 months, with ascites resolved.

other_tests.findings: Granular appearance to the peritoneum and occasional deposits on the serosal surface of the bowel; peritoneal nodules; pleural fluid.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Cultures of peritoneal biopsy and fluid specimens obtained on 11 August 1993 were again positive for C. immitis, but with subsequent treatment, the patient's condition improved, and ascites resolved.

other_tests.findings: Demonstration of spherules of C. immitis within granulomas.
Negative for C. immitis in serum and CSF.
